title: Add a title page to your workflow report
text: length reportTitle longer 1, workflow assume reportTitle advanced title page already formatted markdown. cases, reportTitle used . example , content advanced title page defined. corresponding page includes reference anchor linked using [Title page](#title-page) title markdown title tag table (using kable markdown formatting)
code: titlePage <- c(   anchor("title-page"),   "",   "# A meaningful title",   "",   knitr::kable(     data.frame(       Date = Sys.Date(),       Author = "OSP Suite - Reporting Engine",       Subject = "Example Workflow"     )   ) ) # Here, it is more optimal to re-use the previous workflow # since only the report title page is changed and the same results are used workflow$inactivateTasks("simulate")  workflow$reportTitle <- titlePage  # Re-run the workflow with the new title page workflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:56 #> i Info  Starting run of Mean Model Workflow #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:56 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Time profiles and Residuals task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:56 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Time profiles and Residuals task for A #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:58 #> i Info  Plot Time profiles and Residuals task completed in 0 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:58 #> i Info  Executing: pandoc --embed-resources --standalone --wrap=none --toc --from=markdown+tex_math_dollars+superscript+subscript+raw_attribute --reference-doc="C:/Users/runneradmin/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpE78aUW/temp_libpath11b877417aae/ospsuite.reportingengine/extdata/reference.docx" --resource-path="Example-1" -t docx -o "Example-1/Report-word.docx" "Example-1/Report-word.md" #>  #> 22/05/2024 - 09:21:58 #> i Info  Mean Model Workflow completed in 0 min

what: Use a file as title page
title: Add a title page to your workflow report
text: Another option use markdown file cover page. case, file path can directly defined reportTitle workflow internally check file exists include content. example save previously defined title page file named : Note running workflow won’t delete title page. title file can re-used workflow needs re-run.
code: titlePageFile <- "title-page.md" write(   x = titlePage,   file = titlePageFile ) # Here, it is more optimal to re-use the previous workflow # since only the report title page is changed and the same results are used workflow$reportTitle <- titlePageFile  # Re-run the workflow with the new title page workflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:01 #> i Info  Starting run of Mean Model Workflow #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:01 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Time profiles and Residuals task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:01 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Time profiles and Residuals task for A #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:02 #> i Info  Plot Time profiles and Residuals task completed in 0 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:03 #> i Info  Executing: pandoc --embed-resources --standalone --wrap=none --toc --from=markdown+tex_math_dollars+superscript+subscript+raw_attribute --reference-doc="C:/Users/runneradmin/AppData/Local/Temp/RtmpE78aUW/temp_libpath11b877417aae/ospsuite.reportingengine/extdata/reference.docx" --resource-path="Example-1" -t docx -o "Example-1/Report-word.docx" "Example-1/Report-word.md" #>  #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:03 #> i Info  Mean Model Workflow completed in 0 min file.exists(titlePageFile) #> [1] TRUE

title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: Population workflows, Demography task (plotDemography) aims reporting distributions requested Demography parameters account population workflow type (defined variable PopulationWorkflowTypes). distributions reported graphically using histograms range plots depending workflow settings.

title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: Observed data can included demography plots comparison. Parallel Ratio Comparison histograms, observed demography distributions displayed along simulated demography distribution. Pediatric histograms, distributions simulated populations displayed together figure, observed distributions populations also displayed together figure. range plots, observed demography distributions displayed along simulated demography distribution. illustrated , DataSource objects necessary include observed data demography plots. process, dictionary input metaDataFile essential. Three columns dictionary used workflow order map convert demography parameters. pathID: Defines path demography parameter include datasetColumn: Defines column name demography parameter dataset datasetUnit: Defines unit demography parameter dataset 2 next table shows dictionary first rows observed data used example. Tip: ensure unit defined datasetUnit appropriate, can leverage ospsuite package copy/paste value R. provides sample get appropriate unit BMI (need use format = 13 order keep correct encoded text done square ).
code: # Define file paths for pkml simulation and populations dictionary <- system.file("extdata", "popDictionary.csv",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" ) dataFile <- system.file("extdata", "obsPop.csv",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" )  dataSource <- DataSource$new(   dataFile = dataFile,   metaDataFile = dictionary,   caption = "Demography vignette example" ) writeClipboard(ospsuite::ospUnits$BMI$`kg/m²`, format = 13)

title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: code creates simulation sets used workflow defining simulation, population data files used vignette. example, observed data included using dataSource argument different data selected using dataSelection argument PopulationSimulationSet.
code: # Define file paths for pkml simulation and populations simulationFile <- system.file("extdata", "Aciclovir.pkml", package = "ospsuite") adultFile <- system.file("extdata", "adults.csv", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine") childrenFile <- system.file("extdata", "children.csv", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine")  adultSet <- PopulationSimulationSet$new(   referencePopulation = TRUE,   simulationSetName = "Adults",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   populationFile = adultFile,   dataSource = dataSource,   dataSelection = 'POP %in% "Adults"' )  childrenSet <- PopulationSimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "Children",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   populationFile = childrenFile,   dataSource = dataSource,   dataSelection = 'POP %in% "Children"' )

title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: section describes proceed Parallel Ratio Comparison workflows. creating Parallel Ratio Comparison workflow, plotDemography task includes 2 fields named xParameters yParameters. xParameters defines demography parameters displayed x-axis range plots. xParameters defined (xParameters = NULL), histograms demography parameters defined yParameters performed. yParameters defines demography parameters displayed histograms xParameters y-axis range plots xParameters defines demography parameters. Note parameters can defined vector character values also named list case name used display name figures. default, xParameters = NULL meaning histogram displayed. Users can check default xParameters workflow type using function getDefaultDemographyXParameters(). Default yParameters independent workflow type listed table . define different demography parameters xParameters yParameters, functions setXParametersForDemographyPlot() setYParametersForDemographyPlot() can respectively used.

title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: code initializes parallel comparison workflow activate demography task. plot histograms demography parameters, demography parameters defined xParameters illustrated example defines parameters plotted histograms. define parameters included report, either character array named list can provided. case named list, name displayed using argument query appropriate demography parameter. example, parameter Organism|Age defined Age displayed name. User can also leverage ospsuite package look parameters enum StandardPath. Run corresponding workflow: Parallel Ratio Comparison workflows, demography histograms display distributions simulation set along observed data available (#17, #535). categorical parameters, can noted R factor levels leveraged display name categories . Thus, users need ensure names used population files observed data.
code: parallelWorkflow <- PopulationWorkflow$new(   workflowType = PopulationWorkflowTypes$parallelComparison,   simulationSets = c(adultSet, childrenSet),   workflowFolder = "Parallel-Histograms",   createWordReport = FALSE ) #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:13 #> i Info  Reporting Engine Information: #>  Date: 22/05/2024 - 09:22:13 #>  User Information: #>  Computer Name: fv-az534-287 #>  User: runneradmin #>  Login: runneradmin #>  System is NOT validated #>  System versions: #>  R version: R version 4.4.0 (2024-04-24 ucrt) #>  OSP Suite Package version: 12.0.537 #>  OSP Reporting Engine version: 2.2 #>  tlf version: 1.5.167 inactivateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow) activateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow, tasks = AllAvailableTasks$plotDemography) # Query parameters defined in xParameters getXParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow) #> NULL # Query parameters defined in yParameters getYParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow) #> $Age #> [1] "Organism|Age" #>  #> $Height #> [1] "Organism|Height" #>  #> $Weight #> [1] "Organism|Weight" #>  #> $BMI #> [1] "Organism|BMI" #>  #> $Gender #> [1] "Gender" displayedParameters <- list(   Age = "Organism|Age",   Weight = "Organism|Weight",   Gender = "Gender" )  # Define no parameters in xParameters to get histograms setXParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow, parameters = NULL) # Define parameters to be displayed in histograms as yParameters setYParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow, parameters = displayedParameters) parallelWorkflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:14 #> i Info  Starting run of Population Workflow for parallelComparison #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:14 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Demography task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:24 #> i Info  Plot Demography task completed in 0.2 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:24 #> i Info  Population Workflow for parallelComparison completed in 0.2 min

code: parallelWorkflow <- PopulationWorkflow$new(   workflowType = PopulationWorkflowTypes$parallelComparison,   simulationSets = c(adultSet, childrenSet),   workflowFolder = "Parallel-Range-Plots",   createWordReport = FALSE ) #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:27 #> i Info  Reporting Engine Information: #>  Date: 22/05/2024 - 09:22:27 #>  User Information: #>  Computer Name: fv-az534-287 #>  User: runneradmin #>  Login: runneradmin #>  System is NOT validated #>  System versions: #>  R version: R version 4.4.0 (2024-04-24 ucrt) #>  OSP Suite Package version: 12.0.537 #>  OSP Reporting Engine version: 2.2 #>  tlf version: 1.5.167 inactivateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow) activateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow, tasks = AllAvailableTasks$plotDemography) xParameters <- list(   Age = "Organism|Age",   Gender = "Gender" )  setXParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow, parameters = xParameters) setYParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow, parameters = displayedParameters) parallelWorkflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:28 #> i Info  Starting run of Population Workflow for parallelComparison #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:28 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Demography task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:38 #> i Info  Plot Demography task completed in 0.2 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:22:38 #> i Info  Population Workflow for parallelComparison completed in 0.2 min

what: Continuous vs stair step range plots
title: Demography Parameters in Population Workflows
text: default, demography range plots displayed stair step range plots. however possible connect aggregated values get continuous range plot setting stairstep field FALSE shown . example , continuous range plots included within pediatric workflow:
code: workflow$plotDemography$settings$stairstep <- FALSE pediatricWorkflow <- PopulationWorkflow$new(   workflowType = PopulationWorkflowTypes$pediatric,   simulationSets = c(adultSet, childrenSet),   workflowFolder = "Pediatric-Range",   createWordReport = FALSE ) #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:38 #> i Info  Reporting Engine Information: #>  Date: 22/05/2024 - 09:23:38 #>  User Information: #>  Computer Name: fv-az534-287 #>  User: runneradmin #>  Login: runneradmin #>  System is NOT validated #>  System versions: #>  R version: R version 4.4.0 (2024-04-24 ucrt) #>  OSP Suite Package version: 12.0.537 #>  OSP Reporting Engine version: 2.2 #>  tlf version: 1.5.167 inactivateWorkflowTasks(pediatricWorkflow) activateWorkflowTasks(pediatricWorkflow, tasks = AllAvailableTasks$plotDemography)   displayedParameters <- list(   Age = "Organism|Age",   Weight = "Organism|Weight",   Gender = "Gender" ) setYParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = pediatricWorkflow, parameters = displayedParameters)  # Set up continuous line between bins with stairstep settings being FALSE pediatricWorkflow$plotDemography$settings$stairstep <- FALSE  pediatricWorkflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:38 #> i Info  Starting run of Population Workflow for pediatric #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:38 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Demography task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:47 #> i Info  Plot Demography task completed in 0.2 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:48 #> i Info  Population Workflow for pediatric completed in 0.2 min

code: workflow$plotDemography$settings$dodge <- FALSE parallelWorkflow <- PopulationWorkflow$new(   workflowType = PopulationWorkflowTypes$parallelComparison,   simulationSets = c(adultSet, childrenSet),   workflowFolder = "Parallel-Histograms",   createWordReport = FALSE ) #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:50 #> i Info  Reporting Engine Information: #>  Date: 22/05/2024 - 09:23:50 #>  User Information: #>  Computer Name: fv-az534-287 #>  User: runneradmin #>  Login: runneradmin #>  System is NOT validated #>  System versions: #>  R version: R version 4.4.0 (2024-04-24 ucrt) #>  OSP Suite Package version: 12.0.537 #>  OSP Reporting Engine version: 2.2 #>  tlf version: 1.5.167 inactivateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow) activateWorkflowTasks(parallelWorkflow, tasks = AllAvailableTasks$plotDemography)  displayedParameters <- list(   Age = "Organism|Age",   Weight = "Organism|Weight",   Gender = "Gender" ) setYParametersForDemographyPlot(workflow = parallelWorkflow, parameters = displayedParameters)  # Turn off dodging of histogram bars parallelWorkflow$plotDemography$settings$dodge <- FALSE  parallelWorkflow$runWorkflow() #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:51 #> i Info  Starting run of Population Workflow for parallelComparison #> 22/05/2024 - 09:23:51 #> i Info  Starting run of Plot Demography task #> 22/05/2024 - 09:24:00 #> i Info  Plot Demography task completed in 0.2 min #> 22/05/2024 - 09:24:00 #> i Info  Population Workflow for parallelComparison completed in 0.2 min

title: Excel Template
text: Creating customizing workflow using R can challenging. Leveraging Excel, can define workflow, elements, settings options clicks. Excel template created users can design workflows directly tuning working example.

title: Excel Template
text: Excel template xlsx document defines relevant information working workflow. function createWorkflowFromExcelInput() converts Excel document R script defines workflow plain R code. , can run workflow running R script (e.g. using function source()).

title: Excel Template
text: define include Output objects Simulation Sets, users need 1- Define standard Excel sheet Outputs 2- Declare name created output(s) Excel sheet SimulationSets cell corresponding outputs. drop-menu available allows select directly output defined sheet Outputs. Users can also provide multiple outputs within cell, however need separated comma (character ,).

title: Excel Template
text: define include PK Parameters users need 1- Define Excel sheet using Excel sheet PK Parameter reference (PK Conc Single, PK Conc Multi PK Fraction can also used reference) 2- Declare name created sheet Excel sheet Output object cell corresponding pkParameters

title: Excel Template
text: One additional sheet required user-defined PK Parameters. Use standard Excel sheet Userdef PK Parameter define user-defined PK Parameter include names parameters PK Parameters sheet.

what: How to define observed data sets ?
title: Excel Template
text: Observed data sets managed using DataSource objects. define include observed data users need 1- Define standard Excel sheet Data Sources 2- Declare name sources standard Excel sheet SimulationSet within cell corresponding dataSource. drop-menu available allows select directly data source defined sheet Data Sources. Users can provide unique dataSource within corresponding cell. DataSource objects require metaDataFile defining content observed dataset. meta data can provided either using Excel sheet Excel document using separate csv file. Go standard Excel sheet Data Sources Select option SHEET cell corresponding DictionaryType Include name sheet cell corresponding DictionaryLocation  can use Excel sheet tpDictionary reference Go standard Excel sheet Data Sources Select option FILE cell corresponding DictionaryType Include path file cell corresponding DictionaryLocation  can download use template tpDictionary.csv reference

what: How to set up sensitivity analyses ?
title: Excel Template
text: sensitivity analyses calculate display relative impact selected - - input parameters PK parameters selected output curves, can performed displayed many ways reason, workflows provide lot options settings help design specific analysis wish perform. include sensitivity analysis workflow report, need activate following tasks: simulate, calculatePKParameters, calculateSensitivity, plotSensitivity. activate tasks, go standard Excel sheet Workflow Tasks set Values corresponding cells Yes. Excel sheet, find many options sensitivity analysis section Task-specific options. first set options related calculation sensitivity. options, can set variation range selected input parameters. range defines amplitude variations/perturbations applied around value simulation. details variation range, can check OSP Suite documentation sensitivity analysis. Another option selection specific input parameters applying variations. include selected input parameters users need 1- Define Excel sheet using Excel sheet SensitivityParameter reference 2- Declare name created sheet standard Excel sheet Workflow Tasks cell corresponding calculateSensitivity: variableParameterPaths second set options related sensitivity plots helps defining many input parameters displayed displayed.

what: How add a Study Design table ?
title: Excel Template
text: possible add special parameters variation exported initial population including StudyDesign table workflow. define Study Design tables users can either leverage Excel sheet Excel document can use separate csv file. Go standard Excel sheet SimulationSets Select option SHEET cell corresponding StudyDesignType Include name sheet cell corresponding StudyDesignLocation  can use Excel sheet StudyDesign reference Go standard Excel sheet SimulationSets Select option FILE cell corresponding StudyDesignType Include path file cell corresponding StudyDesignLocation  can download use template StudyDesign.csv reference

what: How to include your own code ?
title: Excel Template
text: Workflows can updated user-defined function execution (e.g. change options, add user-defined tasks, …) including function call line workflow$runWorkflow() R script. , standard Excel sheet Workflow Tasks, can include cell corresponding activitySpecificCode name R function. Note function must placed directory generated R code must 1 argument type "workflow".

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: time profiles residuals task first aims generating time profile plots specified simulation paths. task can account observed data, case residuals calculated plotted. population workflows, aggregation functions used, default mean, median, 5th 95th percentiles computed plotted time profiles.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: Results obtained simulate task stored csv files within subdirectory SimulationResults workflowFolder directory required order perform goodness fit (plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals) task. consequence, workflow output folder include appropriate simulations, task simulate needs active. objects SimulationSet (PopulationSimulationSet population workflows) Output define simulated , available, observed data plotted.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: time profiles residuals task generates simulation set plots : linear logarithmic scale available data total simulated time range.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: simulations multiple applications, 6 time profile plots can generated corresponding simulated time profiles linear logarithmic scale : total simulated time range time range first application time range last application input applicationRanges SimulationSet objects can used select ranges include evaluation.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: observed data available range selected output definition selected dataSelection, added time profile plots. Furthermore, residuals calculated according residual scale defined Output objects included within simulation sets 6 additional plots created figures: Predicted vs observed linear scale Predicted vs observed log scale Residuals vs time Residuals vs simulated output Histogram residuals qq-plot residuals residual scale corresponds one element enum ResidualScales: default uses “Logarithmic” calculate residuals : \(Residuals=log(Observed)-log(Simulated)\) option “Linear” used instead, residuals calculated : \(Residuals=Observed-Simulated\) histogram qq-plot residuals across simulation sets also added end analysis. population workflows, residuals calculated aggregation Simulated output. default, \(median(Simulated)\) used instead \(Simulated\). possible modify aggregation function updating fields object AggregationConfiguration.

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: following sections introduce template scripts including goodness fit tasks well associated reports. Table 1 shows features tested template script. Table 1: Features tested template script

title: Time profiles and Residuals task
text: Example 1 shows one simplest workflows including goodness fit. example, simulation time profile performed since observed data. Furthermore, one simulation set one output requested. output report Example 1 shown . 2 figures report (linear log scales) showing time profile output path ‘Organism||Concentration container’ displayed ‘Concentration ’.

title: Mass Balance
text: Mean Model workflows, Mass Balance task (plotMassBalance) aims reporting diagnostics simulation mass balance. diagnostic plots correspond 5 plots molecule (group molecules defined user) : Plot 1: Amount vs time Plot 2: Cumulative amount vs time amounts molecule paths included stacked . Plot 3: Normalized amount vs time amounts normalized drug mass applied current time. Plot 4: Normalized cumulative amount vs time cumulative amounts normalized drug mass applied current time. Plot 5: Pie Chart displaying fraction drug mass last simulated time point molecule paths included. Since version 2.3, normalization uses current drug mass final drug mass. result, normalized plots 3 4 provide realistic results case multiple applications.

title: Mass Balance
text: field "Groupings" array defines group label molecule paths mass balance diagnostic plots. Thus, element "Groupings" includes following fields: "Name": reported name group "Include": array included molecule paths "Exclude": array excluded molecule paths (optional) "ExcludePreviousGroupings": logical exclude molecule paths already included previous groupings (optional - default true) Note inclusion exclusion criteria molecule paths leverage wild card symbols (*). common use case include paths specific compartments Plasma. translate : Another use case metabolite defined using molecule name prefix. , metabolite can included grouping.

title: Get Started
text: ospsuite.reportingengine package aims facilitating design build reports evaluating PBPK models developed PK-Sim /MoBi. end, package benefits concept R6 classes (similar reference classes) allows define structured objects whose fields can object properties, methods even R6 objects. R6 objects, objects R6 class, presents peculiarities. usually initialized using method $new(...) (e.g. r6Object <- R6Class$new()). Similarly objects class list, fields R6 objects can called using either $fieldName [[fieldName]] (e.g. r6Object$method() r6Object[[property]]). R6 class also integrates concept inheritance: R6 object get attributes class also inherit properties methods parent class.

title: Get Started
text: ospsuite.reportingengine package built around 3 central R6 classes MeanModelWorkflow, PopulationWorkflow QualificationWorkflow derived parent R6 class Workflow. creation MeanModelWorkflow PopulationWorkflow objects provides structured environment methods properties facilitate design, run report evaluations PBPK models developed PK-Sim /MoBi. QualificationWorkflow objects, details available dedicated article. Worklow objects combine 2 features defined R6 objects: SimulationSet PopulationSimulationSet objects defines model(s) /data can used workflow (developed details section 3). objects need created creation workflow objects required create workflow. Task objects define evaluations performed workflow. objects directly created included upon creation Workflow objects (developed details section 4). settings can checked updated creation.

title: Get Started
text: order define run appropriately Workflow object, steps required: Load ospsuite.reportingengine package Define simulation outputs possibly PK parameters Define simulation sets possibly mapping simulations observed data Define workflow result folder Define workflow tasks Run workflow working example workflow script provided reporting time profile plot Minimodel2.pkml. example, list files folders generated workflow : associated report follows:
code: library(ospsuite.reportingengine) Output$new() SimulationSet$new() Workflow$new() workflow$activateTasks() workflow$runWorkflow() # Get the pkml simulation file: "MiniModel2.pkml" simulationFile <- system.file("extdata", "MiniModel2.pkml",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" )  # Create Output objects which define output paths that will be plotted by the workflow outputA <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|A|Concentration in container",   displayName = "Concentration of A" ) outputB <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|B|Concentration in container",   displayName = "Concentration of B" )  # Create a SimulationSet object which defines the model and outputs to evaluate myExampleSet <- SimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "My example",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   outputs = c(outputA, outputB) )  # Create the workflow object myExampleWorkflow <-   MeanModelWorkflow$new(     simulationSets = myExampleSet,     workflowFolder = "myExample-Results"   )  # Set the workflow tasks to be run myExampleWorkflow$activateTasks(c("simulate", "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals"))  # Run the workflow myExampleWorkflow$runWorkflow() list.files(myExampleWorkflow$workflowFolder) #> [1] "log-debug.txt"     "log-info.txt"      "Report-word.md"    #> [4] "Report.docx"       "Report.md"         "SimulationResults" #> [7] "TimeProfiles"

title: Get Started
text: Workflow objects define models evaluated, evaluated evaluations reported. ospsuite.reportingengine package, two types Workflow available can created: MeanModelWorkflow dedicated evaluations specific mean models PopulationWorkflow dedicated evaluations specific population models

title: Get Started
text: Workflows defined MeanModelWorkflow objects can illustrated Figure 1. blue frame corresponds inputs workflow. inputs need defined using SimulationSet objects. workflows multiple simulations observed datasets, list SimulationSet objects can input instead one unique SimulationSet object. Within Workflow object, simulation sets accessible simulationStructures lists also provides relevant information input/output files folders black frames correspond tasks evaluations performed workflow. tasks defined using Task objects built every Workflow object, meaning need input creating Workflow object. Users access, update switch task /tasks creation Workflow. Figure 1: Mean model workflow inputs tasks

title: Get Started
text: Workflows defined PopulationWorkflow objects can illustrated Figure 2. blue frame corresponds inputs workflow. inputs need defined using PopulationSimulationSet objects. workflows multiple simulations observed datasets, list PopulationSimulationSet objects can input instead one unique PopulationSimulationSet object. Within Workflow object, simulation sets accessible simulationStructures lists also provides relevant information input/output files folders black frames correspond tasks evaluations performed workflow. tasks defined using Task objects built every Workflow object, meaning need input creating Workflow object. Users access, update switch task /tasks creation Workflow. tasks population workflows perform direct comparison simulation sets (e.g. plotDemography plotPKParameters). comparisons can different according selected population workflow types. Three population workflow types available ospsuite.reportingengine defined PopulationWorkflowTypes: properties (physiology PK Parameter) plotted vs. age weight, time profiles plotted comparison reference population sensitivity analysis done populations except reference population PK parameter plotted parallel Box-Whisker plots without reference population, reference population given, time profiles plotted comparison population sensitivity analysis done populations parallel comparison, PK Parameter additional ratio PK Parameter reference population calculated plotted box-whisker plots Figure 2: Population workflow inputs tasks

what: 2.5. Workflow built in methods and properties
title: Get Started
text: creation Workflow object, built methods properties available (using character $ name object). workflow properties correspond inputs used create workflow includes createWordReport, workflowFolder, reportFilePath, list simulationStructures workflow tasks (developed section 4). Additionally, methods listed can used access relevant information workflow: printReportingEngineInfo(): prints information environment packages currently used. getWatermark(): prints watermark displayed workflow. getParameterDisplayPaths(): prints mapping parameters display paths getSimulationDescriptor(): prints simulation descriptor used workflow getAllTasks(): prints names workflow available tasks getAllPlotTasks(): prints names workflow plot tasks getActiveTasks(): prints names workflow active tasks getInactiveTasks(): prints names workflow inactive tasks update workflow properties, methods listed can used: setWatermark(watermark): set watermark displayed workflow. input watermark type character. setWorkflowParameterDisplayPaths(parameterDisplayPaths, workflow) setWorkflowParameterDisplayPathsFromFile(fileName, workflow) setSimulationDescriptor(text): set simulation descriptor workflow. input text type character. Finally, method runWorkflow() runs simulations analyses models, also saves evaluations report.

title: Get Started
text: dictionary csv file mapping data file. Unlike Matlab version reporting engine, regular csv comma (“,”) separator expected. dictionary file must contain following variables: ‘ID’, ‘type’, ‘datasetColumn’, ‘datasetUnit’, ‘reportName’, ‘pathID’, ‘comment’. time profile plots, must provide ‘time’ ‘dv’ ‘ID’. variable ‘lloq’, lower limit quantitation, can also provided necessary. variables need mapped variable names dataset using dictionary variable ‘nonmenColumn’. Regarding units, two options possible: Providing units using dictionary: ‘time’ ‘dv’ column ‘nonmemUnit’ filled corresponding unit (‘lloq’ assumed unit ‘dv’). dictionary must include following new variables ‘ID’: ‘time_unit’ ‘dv_unit’. dictionary must also include mapping variable names dataset using ‘nonmenColumn’. example shows content dictionary template tpDictionary.csv: Table 3: Template data dictionary

title: Get Started

title: Get Started
text: tasks goodness fit, observed data can used. Usually, data included one unique Nonmem data file needs filtered associated correct path. input variable dataSelection provides filter Nonmem data file. must R readable code, using Nonmem headers variable names (e.g. ‘SID>0’ ‘AGE<12 & SEX==1’). default, dataSelection = ‘NONE’. Consequently, data selected evaluation performed. want use , can include filter dataSelection = ‘’.

title: Get Started
text: input pkParameters indicates path related PK parameters user wants include analysis. list pk parameter names can directly provided input (e.g. c(‘C_max’, ‘AUC_inf’)). Display names display units used PK parameter objects defined using ospsuite package. case different display names /units needed PK parameters different paths, also possible use PkParameterInfo instances instead pk parameter names directly. However, case display names units used, better practice define update PK parameters, display names units beforehand ospsuite package, provide directly list names input pkParameters. Updating PK parameters, display names units can done directly : updatePKParameter(). Users can also create PK parameters using: addUserDefinedPKParameter().

title: Get Started
text: illustrated Figures 1 2, workflows perform multiple evaluations tasks list simulation sets. evaluations defined using Task objects built-properties Workflow objects. know tasks workflow can perform, workflow method getAllTasks() can used. Usually, tasks required run workflow, led Task objects include logical field active defining task performed . workflow methods getActiveTasks() getInactiveTasks() provide names active inactive tasks workflow, respectively. modify tasks run, active field task can updated. workflow methods activateTasks(taskNames) inactivateTasks(inactivateTasks) provide fast easy way update tasks run. particular, default value input taskNames getAllTasks(), meaning using activateTasks() without argument activate every task workflow. Additionally, enums StandardSimulationTasks StandardPlotTasks respectively provide quick access standard simulation plot tasks common mean model population workflows. Using example shown section 1.4.. task names mean model workflow : activation/inactivation tasks can done follows:
code: # Names of standard simulation tasks StandardSimulationTasks #> $simulate #> [1] "simulate" #>  #> $calculatePKParameters #> [1] "calculatePKParameters" #>  #> $calculateSensitivity #> [1] "calculateSensitivity" # Names of standard plot tasks StandardPlotTasks #> $plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" #>  #> $plotPKParameters #> [1] "plotPKParameters" #>  #> $plotSensitivity #> [1] "plotSensitivity" # All workflow's tasks myExampleWorkflow$getAllTasks() #> [1] "plotSensitivity"              "plotPKParameters"             #> [3] "plotAbsorption"               "plotMassBalance"              #> [5] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "calculateSensitivity"         #> [7] "calculatePKParameters"        "simulate" # Only active tasks that are run myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "simulate" # Only inactive tasks that are not run myExampleWorkflow$getInactiveTasks() #> [1] "plotSensitivity"       "plotPKParameters"      "plotAbsorption"        #> [4] "plotMassBalance"       "calculateSensitivity"  "calculatePKParameters" # Inactivate all tasks myExampleWorkflow$inactivateTasks() myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> NULL # Activate only tasks "simulate" and "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" tasks myExampleWorkflow$activateTasks(c("simulate", "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals")) myExampleWorkflow$getActiveTasks() #> [1] "plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals" "simulate"

title: Get Started
text: workflow settings defined, workflow method $runWorkflow() run active tasks generate associated results report. following outputs generated workflowFolder directory: logs, results directories reports.

title: Get Started
text: Three types logs can generated creation, design run workflow: log-info.txt contains information like starting time version numbers used software log-error.txt contains errors warnings occurred execution log-debug.txt contains information useful debugging purpose.

title: Get Started
text: task save results dedicated directory. names results directory follow: SimulationResults contains results simulation runs, obtained simulate task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importResultsFromCSV(). PKAnalysisResults contains results PK analysis runs, obtained calculatePKParameters task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importPKAnalysesFromCSV(). SensitivityResults contains results sensitivity analysis runs, obtained calculateSensitivity task, csv files. possible load results using ospsuite method importSensitivityAnalysisResultsFromCSV(). TimeProfiles contains figures obtained plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals task source values png csv files. PKAnalysis contains figures tables obtained plotPKParameters task source values png csv files. Sensitivity contains figures obtained plotSensitivity task source values png csv files. MassBalance contains figures tables obtained plotMassBalance task source values png csv files. directory specific mean model workflows. Absorption contains figures tables obtained plotAbsorption task source values png csv files. directory specific mean model workflows. Demography contains figures tables obtained plotDemography task source values png csv files. directory specific population model workflows. Default figure format png, possible change default using setPlotFormat().

title: Get Started
text: plot task save appendix file besides results markdown format report. appendices saved directly within workflowFolder directory results directory following names: appendix-time-profile.md plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals task. appendix-pk-parameters.md plotPKParameters task. appendix-sensitivity-analysis.md plotSensitivity task. appendix-mass-balance.md plotMassBalance task. appendix-absorption.md plotAbsorption task. appendix-demography.md plotDemography task. end workflow run, available appendices combined final reports: Report.md contains markdown version report, including table content numbering figures tables. Report-word.md contains markdown version report translated pandoc generating word report. Report.docx contains word version report, including table content numbering figures tables. option createWordReport set TRUE default can set FALSE prevent conversion Report-word.md Report.docx using pandoc .

title: Plot settings
text: vignette provides guidance define properties settings reporting engine. properties can 2 levels: Global workflow plot configuration, affecting every plot workflow output Local task plot configuration, affecting specific plots within task

what: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: Reporting Engine global setting names listed enum reSettingsNames. global setting can reviewed using function getRESettings(). possible update, save reuse reporting engine default settings using functions available section Default Settings. Note function resetRESettingsToDefault() allows reset initial default values defined reporting engine.

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: theme object R6 class Theme defines default properties used build every plot tlf package. information can found directly within documentation tlf package (vignettes “theme-maker” “plot-configuration”). best workflow set Theme object use json files. Templates json files available tlf package location defined : Modifications theme properties can done directly updating properties Theme object shown : save updated Theme object, function saveThemeToJson provided tlf package can used. addition, tlf package provides Shiny app define save theme clicks: tlf::runThemeMaker(). , important step define Theme object current default workflow. ospsuite.reportingengine, can either achieved using function setDefaultTheme Theme object shown example reTheme. properties defined Theme object used default specific plot configurations provided workflow plots. Caution: loading workflow re-initialize default theme. function setDefaultTheme() needs called initialization workflow. Additionally, Workflow objects theme input argument available method $new() use input theme instead reporting engine default.
code: # Get the path of the Json template jsonFile <- system.file("extdata", "re-theme.json",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" )  # Load the theme from the json file reTheme <- tlf::loadThemeFromJson(jsonFile) # Overwrite the current background fill reTheme$background$panel$fill <- "white" reTheme$background$panel$fill #> [1] "white" # Save your updated theme in "my-new-theme.json" tlf::saveThemeToJson("my-new-theme.json", theme = reTheme) # Set reTheme as current default Theme setDefaultTheme(reTheme)

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
what: Exporting plots in a specific format
title: Plot settings
text: One important global setting format figure files (e.g. png, jpg pdf) well quality figures. default, figures saved png files size 20 x 15 cm. format settings can managed using function setDefaultPlotFormat() illustrated , input arguments format, width, height, units plot resolution dpi.

previous_headings: How to set global workflow properties
title: Plot settings
text: Watermark corresponds text background plots. Watermark font properties can set Theme object: reTheme$fonts$watermark. Regarding content watermark, default content available Theme object (.e. reTheme$background$watermark example) overwritten Workflow objects: system validated, text printed background default. system validated, text “preliminary results” printed background default. consequence, setting watermark content needs performed directly Workflow objects: either initializing workflow using input argument watermark (e.g. MeanModelWorkflow$new(..., watermark = "vignette example")); using workflow method $setWatermark(watermark) (e.g. myWorkflow$setWatermark("vignette example")). workflow method $getWatermark() prints watermark text background figures output workflow (e.g. myWorkflow$getWatermark()). Note: NULL input argument watermark leads using default watermark feature.

what: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: task Workflow objects includes field named settings. optional field class TaskSettings can updated overwrite default behavior task. Two usual subfields settings : plotConfigurations bins. settings can also provided detailed next sections. plotConfigurations list PlotConfiguration objects tlf package. PlotConfiguration R6 class plot properties stored used create plots desired configuration. information can found notion within tlf vignette “plot-configuration”. Providing user-defined PlotConfiguration object input list overwrite default configuration used generate task corresponding task plot(s). bins can number, vector function used bin histograms. next section provide names plots options can accessed field settings.

previous_headings: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: Regardless workflow subclass (MeanModelWorkflow PopulationWorkflow), names plotConfigurations list available “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task following: “timeProfile”: time profile plots linear log scale “obsVsPred”: observed vs simulated data linear log scale “resVsPred”: residuals vs simulated data plots “resVsTime”: residuals vs time plots “resHisto”: histograms residuals “resQQPlot”: qq-plots residuals “histogram”: histograms residuals across simulations “qqPlot”: qq-plots residuals across simulations Since histograms performed task, bins can also defined. Displayed names units usually managed SimulationSet Output objects. vignette “goodness--fit” provides details “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task. Example: shows typical mean model workflow example plotConfigurations bins set “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task. next chunk code define PlotConfiguration objects included settings: , settings field “plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals” task can updated shown : run workflow updated settings get resulting report shown . Since histogram across simulations get plot configuration settings defined individual simulations, plots quite different. However, option bins currently set among plots task. Regarding observed vs simulated plots, got updated xlabel, ylabel watermark defined plot configuration.

previous_headings: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: Selection, displayed names units usually managed ospsuite PKParameters objects PkParametersInfo objects. vignette “pk-parameters” provides details “plotPKParameters” task. mean model workflows, PK parameters summarized tables. current version, option number decimal numbers set. population workflows, parameters described using plots depends population workflow type. names plotConfigurations list available “plotPKParameters” task following: “boxplotPkParameters”: boxplots PK parameters performed parallel comparison ratio types population workflows “boxplotPkRatios”: boxplots PK parameters ratios performed ratio type population workflows “vpcParameterPlot”: VPC like plots PK parameters vs Demography parameters performed pediatric type population workflows “comparisonVpcPlot”: VPC like plots PK parameters vs Demography parameters comparing reference population performed pediatric type Since pediatric workflows perform VPC like plot, aggregation data performed along demography parameters. binning demography parameters can set optional field bins task field settings. field can either unique value corresponding number bins vector defining bin edges demography parameter paths. Besides, final plot can either link aggregated values plot stairstep. default behaviour perform stairstep plot, can tuned optional field stairstep (TRUE/FALSE) task field settings. shows examples set options:
code: # Associate the bin edges workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$bins <- c(0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 10)  # Associate the number of bins workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$bins <- 15  # Set VPC as stair step workflowA$plotPKParameters$settings$stairstep <- TRUE

previous_headings: How to set task specific properties
title: Plot settings
text: Settings sensitivity plots SensitivityPlotSettings objects. vignette “sensitivity-analysis” provides details “plotSensitivity” task. input argument SensitivityPlotSettings settings object (created using SensitivityPlotSettings$new()): totalSensitivityThreshold: cut-used plots sensitive parameters; default 0.9. variableParameterPaths: paths varied sensitivity analysis. supplied totalSensitivityThreshold 1, else uses default user-provided value. maximalParametersPerSensitivityPlot: maximal number parameters display sensitivity plot. default, maximal number parameters display 50. plotConfiguration: PlotConfiguration object tlf library xAxisFontSize: Font size x-axis labels sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default font size 6. yAxisFontSize: Font size y-axis labels sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default font size 6. xLabel Label x-axis sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default xLabel “Sensitivity”. yLabel Label y-axis sensitivity plot, can overwrite behavior plotConfiguration. Default yLabel NULL. colorPalette Name color palette used ggplot2::scale_fill_brewer() sensitivity plot. Default color palette “Spectral”. Since displayed sensitivity parameters can include long strings characters shrinking actual plot even using small yAxisFontSize, algorithm providing line breaks included task prevent shrinking issue much possible. Two fields available settings tune algorithm: maxWidthPerParameter maximum width display parameters. Parameters longer line breaks. default maximum width 25 characters. maxLinesPerParameter maximum number lines display parameters. default maximum number lines 3. parameters longer maxLinesPerParameter*maxWidthPerParameter, maxLinesPerParameter setting respected.

title: Plot settings
text: name plotConfigurations list available “plotAbsorption” task following: “absorptionPlot”

title: Plot settings
text: name plotConfigurations list available “plotMassBalance” task following: “timeProfile”: time profile plots mass balance linear log scales “cumulativeTimeProfile”: cumulative time profile plots mass balance linear log scales “normalizedTimeProfile”: normalized time profile plots (fraction drug mass) mass balance linear log scales “normalizedCumulativeTimeProfile”: cumulative normalized time profile plots mass balance linear log scales “pieChart”: pie chart mass balance last simulated time point Another field settings selectedCompoundNames allows keep selected list compounds kept mass balance plots.

title: Plot settings
text: names plotConfigurations list available “plotDemography” task following: “histogram”: histogram Demography parameters performed parallel comparison ratio types population workflows “vpcParameterPlot”: VPC like plots Demography parameters vs Demography parameters performed pediatric type population workflows “comparisonVpcPlot”: VPC like plots Demography parameters vs Demography parameters comparing reference population performed pediatric type Since pediatric workflows perform VPC like plot, aggregation data performed along demography parameters. binning demography parameters can set optional field bins task field settings. field can either unique value corresponding number bins vector defining bin edges demography parameter paths. Besides, final plot can either link aggregated values plot stairstep. default behaviour perform stairstep plot, can tuned optional field stairstep (TRUE/FALSE) task field settings. Similarly, parallel comparison ratio types population workflows perform histograms, whose binning can set using settings field bins.

title: PK Parameters in Population Workflows
text: Population workflows, PK parameters task (plotPKParameters) aims reporting distributions requested PK parameters account population workflow type (defined variable PopulationWorkflowTypes). distributions quantified tables describing key statistics percentiles reported graphically using box range plots.

title: PK Parameters in Population Workflows
text: Results obtained calculatePKParameters task stored csv files within subdirectory PKAnalysisResults workflowFolder directory required order perform PK parameters (plotPKParameters) task. consequence, workflow output folder include appropriate simulations, task calculatePKParameters needs active.

title: PK Parameters in Population Workflows
text: PopulationSimulationSet Output objects define simulated PK parameters reported. Especially, Output objects define paths PK Parameters calculated. code defines files used definition population simulation sets well Output object describing PK parameters display report.
code: # Define file paths for pkml simulation and populations simulationFile <- system.file("extdata", "MiniModel2.pkml",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" ) populationFile500 <- system.file("extdata", "Pop500_p1p2p3.csv",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" ) populationFile200 <- system.file("extdata", "Pop200_p1p2p3.csv",   package = "ospsuite.reportingengine" )  # Update PK Parameters to display appropriate names in reports updatePKParameter("C_max", displayName = "Cmax") #> PKParameter:  #>    Name: C_max  #>    DisplayName: Cmax  #>    Dimension: Concentration (molar)  #>    DisplayUnit: µmol/l updatePKParameter("AUC_tEnd", displayName = "AUC") #> PKParameter:  #>    Name: AUC_tEnd  #>    DisplayName: AUC  #>    Dimension: AUC (molar)  #>    DisplayUnit: µmol*min/l # Define paths and PK parameters to report outputA <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|A|Concentration in container",   displayName = "A",   pkParameters = c("C_max", "AUC_tEnd") )

title: PK Parameters in Population Workflows
text: parallelComparison workflow type, distributions graphically reported box-whisker plots displaying 5th, 25th, 50th, 75th 95th percentiles linear logarithmic scales. Moreover, table reporting population simulation set, name, size, 5th, 25th, 50th, 75th 95th percentiles, arithmetic mean, standard deviation (SD) coefficient variation (CV) well geometric mean, SD CV.

title: PK Parameters in Population Workflows

text: QualificationWorkflow objects include configurationPlan field. field ConfigurationPlan object provides smart interface building report. particular, fields reorganized data.frame format clarifying design configuration plan. simulationMappings observedDataSets sections Additionally, configurationPlan field includes many get methods search specific paths files managed configuration plan ($getSimulationPath(project, simulation), $getObservedDataPath(id), etc)

title: Qualification Workflow
text: Two simulation tasks available active default qualification workflows: simulate: simulate time profile results requested report plots calculatePKParameters: calculate PK Parameters requested PK DDI ratio plots results stored within workflowFolder output directory, SimulationResults PKAnalysisResults directories respectively. Five plot tasks available qualification workflows, active defined configuration plan: plotTimeProfiles: plot time profiles simulated outputs /observed data. plotGOFMerged: plot goodness fit results grouped simulated outputs vs observed data. plotComparisonTimeProfile: plot comparison time profiles simulated outputs /observed data. plotPKRatio: plot PK ratios simulated vs observed PK parameters function covariate (usually Age). plotDDIRatio: plot Drug-Drug Interaction ratios simulated vs observed PK parameters.

title: Qualification Workflow
text: settings artifacts read configuration plan file translated task settings. Settings simulations include showProgress show progress simulate task allowedCores perform simulations parallel. Plot tasks can include multiple results report, usually called artifacts. field Artifacts mentioned plot configuration plan, corresponding artifacts results added report.

what: How to update and re-run a qualification workflow

text: simulations need re-run, advised reload workflow using loadQualificationWorkflow. case update require re-run simulations (e.g. updating section content, modifying plot aesthetics removing plot), QualificationWorkflow method $updateConfigurationPlan(configurationPlanFile) can used avoid process reloading checking simulations workflow. , can also inactivate tasks corresponding re-run simulations re-running workflow.
code: # Reload Configuration Plan workflow$updateConfigurationPlan(   configurationPlanFile = newConfigurationPlanFile )  # Inactivate simulations already performed workflow$simulate$inactivate() workflow$calculatePKParameters$inactivate()  # Re-run and build updated report workflow$runWorkflow()

title: Qualification Workflow
text: template R script qualification workflows available following link qualification-workflow-template.R. template aims creating function wrapping usage qualification workflow including call qualification runner named createQualificationReport.
code: #' @title createQualificationReport #' @description Run a qualification workflow to create a qualification report. #' @param qualificationRunnerFolder Folder where QualificationRunner.exe is located #' @param pkSimPortableFolder Folder where PK-Sim is located. #' If not specified, installation path will be read from the registry (available only in case of full **non-portable** installation). #' This option is **MANDATORY** for the portable version of PK-Sim. #' @param createWordReport Logical defining if a `docx` version of the report should also be created. #' Note that `pandoc` installation is required for this feature #' [https://github.com/Open-Systems-Pharmacology/OSPSuite.ReportingEngine/wiki/Installing-pandoc] #' @param maxSimulationsPerCore An integer that set the maximimum number of simulations per core #' @param versionInfo A `QualificationVersionInfo` object to update title page with Qualification Version Information #' @param wordConversionTemplate File name of docx template document passed to Pandoc for the conversion of the md report into docx #' Default template is available using `system.file("extdata", "reference.docx", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine")` #' @examples #' # Create a Qualification Report without any option and running v9.1.1 of Qualification Runner #' createQualificationReport("C:/Software/QualificationRunner9.1.1") #'  #' # Create a Qualification Report and turn of the creation of a doc version #' createQualificationReport("C:/Software/QualificationRunner9.1.1", createWordReport = FALSE) #'  #' # Create a Qualification Report and set the number of simulations to be run per core #' createQualificationReport("C:/Software/QualificationRunner9.1.1", maxSimulationsPerCore = 8) #'  #' # Create a Qualification Report and update Qualification Version Information on title page #' versionInfo <- QualificationVersionInfo$new("1.1", "2.2","3.3") #' createQualificationReport("C:/Software/QualificationRunner9.1.1", versionInfo = versionInfo) #'  createQualificationReport <- function(qualificationRunnerFolder,                                       pkSimPortableFolder = NULL,                                       createWordReport = TRUE,                                       maxSimulationsPerCore = NULL,                                       versionInfo = NULL,                                       wordConversionTemplate = NULL) {   library(ospsuite.reportingengine)   # Reset settings such as plot theme or format of numeric in tables   # to Reporting Engine default values   resetRESettingsToDefault()    #-------- STEP 1: Define workflow settings --------#   #' replace `workingDirectory` and `qualificationPlanName` with your paths   #'   #' The directories are assumed the following structure   #' `workingDirectory`   #'   - `input`   #'     - `qualificationPlanName`   #'   - `re_input`   #'     - `configurationPlanFile`   #'   - `re_output`   #'     - `report`   #'   #' In case your folder structure is different from assumed above,   #' the paths below must be adjusted as well:   #' - `qualificationPlanFile`: path of qualification plan file run by Qualification Runner   #' - `reInputFolder`: input path for the Reporting engine   #' - `reOutputFolder`: outputs of the Reporting Engine will be created here   #' - `reportName`:  path of final report   #'   #' **Template parameters to be replaced below**    #' `workingDirectory`: current directory is used as default working directory   workingDirectory <- getwd()    qualificationPlanName <- "qualification_plan.json"   qualificationPlanFile <- file.path(workingDirectory, "input", qualificationPlanName)    #' The default outputs of qualification runner should be generated under `<workingDirectory>/re_input`   reInputFolder <- file.path(workingDirectory, "re_input")   #' The default outputs or RE should be generated under `<workingDirectory>/re_output`   reOutputFolder <- file.path(workingDirectory, "re_output")    #' Configuration Plan created from the Qualification Plan by the Qualification Runner   configurationPlanName <- "report-configuration-plan"   configurationPlanFile <- file.path(reInputFolder, paste0(configurationPlanName, ".json"))    #' Option to record the time require to run the workflow.   #' The timer will calculate calculation time form internal `Sys.time` function   recordWorkflowTime <- TRUE    #' Set watermark that will appear in all generated plots   #' Default is no watermark. `Label` objects from `tlf` package can be used to specifiy watermark font.   watermark <- ""    #' If not set, report created will be named `report.md` and located in the worflow folder namely `reOutputFolder`   reportFolder <- file.path(workingDirectory, "report")   reportPath <- file.path(reportFolder, "report.md")      #----- Optional parameters for the Qualification Runner -----#   #' If not null, `logFile` is passed internally via the `-l` option   logFile <- NULL   #' If not null, `logLevel` is passed internally via the `--logLevel` option   logLevel <- NULL   #' If `overwrite` is set to true, eventual results from the previous run of the QualiRunner/RE will be removed first   overwrite <- TRUE    #-------- STEP 2: Qualification Runner  --------#   #' Start timer to track time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     tic <- as.numeric(Sys.time())   }    #' Start Qualification Runner to generate inputs for the reporting engine   startQualificationRunner(     qualificationRunnerFolder = qualificationRunnerFolder,     qualificationPlanFile = qualificationPlanFile,     outputFolder = reInputFolder,     pkSimPortableFolder = pkSimPortableFolder,     configurationPlanName = configurationPlanName,     overwrite = overwrite,     logFile = logFile,     logLevel = logLevel   )    #' Print timer tracked time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     toc <- as.numeric(Sys.time())     print(paste0("Qualification Runner Duration: ", round((toc - tic) / 60, 1), " minutes"))   }    #-------- STEP 3: Run Qualification Workflow  --------#   # If version info is provided update title page   titlePageFile <- file.path(reInputFolder, "Intro/titlepage.md")    addTitlePage <- all(     !is.null(versionInfo),     file.exists(titlePageFile)   )   if(addTitlePage){     adjustTitlePage(titlePageFile, qualificationVersionInfo = versionInfo)   }      #' Load `QualificationWorkflow` object from configuration plan   workflow <- loadQualificationWorkflow(     workflowFolder = reOutputFolder,     configurationPlanFile = configurationPlanFile   )    #' Set the name of the final report   workflow$reportFilePath <- reportPath   workflow$createWordReport <- createWordReport   workflow$wordConversionTemplate <- wordConversionTemplate    #' Set watermark. If set, it will appear in all generated plots   workflow$setWatermark(watermark)    #' Set the maximimum number of simulations per core if defined   if(!is.null(maxSimulationsPerCore)){     workflow$simulate$settings$maxSimulationsPerCore <- maxSimulationsPerCore   }      #' @note Activate/Inactivate tasks of qualification workflow prior running   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("simulate")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("calculatePKParameters")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("plotTimeProfiles")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("plotComparisonTimeProfile")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("plotGOFMerged")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("plotPKRatio")   #' workflow$inactivateTasks("plotDDIRatio")      #' Run the `QualificatitonWorklfow`   workflow$runWorkflow()    #' Print timer tracked time if option `recordWorkflowTime` is set to TRUE   if (recordWorkflowTime) {     toc <- as.numeric(Sys.time())     print(paste0("Qualification Workflow Total Duration: ", round((toc - tic) / 60, 1), " minutes"))   }   return(invisible()) }

Tables figures numbered internally within first level sections (section whose title start one markdown character "#" also referenced). algorithm numbering figures tables look keywords Figure: Table: first element line (italic/bold characters ignored algorithm space keyword "*" "_" characters). references follow nomenclature : Figures: <id="figure-<section number>-<internal figure count>"></> Table: <id="table-<section number>-<internal table count>"></> instance, second table encountered within section 3 (e.g. section 3.1.4) referenced: <id="table-3-2"></>

title: Sensitivity Analysis

what: Specification of quantities analyzed: model outputs and PK parameters
title: Sensitivity Analysis
text: sensitivity analysis compute variation scalar function time-series trajectory model output response variations model variables. model outputs specified using paths simulated quantities within model. scalar functions PK parameter quantities C_max AUC. Although sensitivity analysis mean model individual within population evaluated PK parameters, user option specifying subset PK parameters sensitivity plots generated. addition, user option set custom display names selected model outputs PK parameters used sensitivity analysis. Sets output PK parameter combinations sensitivity analysis defined follows: , output1 output2 Output objects. path input constructors objects gives path model output. example, path input output1 points concentration caffeine lung interstitial tissue, Organism|Lung|Interstitial|Caffeine|Concentration. model output given display name op1. PK parameters chosen example C_max MRT, given display names new_C_max new_MRT, respectively. Similarly, output2 points model output path Organism|ArterialBlood|Plasma|Caffeine|Concentration. PK parameters selected output2 t_max AUC_tEnd, respective display names new_t_max new_AUC_tEnd used.
code: output1 <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|Lung|Interstitial|Caffeine|Concentration", displayName = "op1",   pkParameters = c(     PkParameterInfo$new("C_max", "new_C_max"),     PkParameterInfo$new("MRT", "new_MRT")   ) ) output2 <- Output$new(   path = "Organism|ArterialBlood|Plasma|Caffeine|Concentration", displayName = "op2",   pkParameters = c(     PkParameterInfo$new("t_max", "new_t_max"),     PkParameterInfo$new("AUC_tEnd", "new_AUC_tEnd")   ) )

code: ms <- SimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "simulationSet1",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   outputs = c(output1, output2) ) mwf <- MeanModelWorkflow$new(   simulationSets = ms,   workflowFolder = "meanSensitivityExample" ) mwf$simulate$activate() mwf$calculateSensitivity$activate() mwf$plotSensitivity$activate() mwf$calculateSensitivity$settings$variableParameterPaths <- c(   "Organism|Heart|Volume",   "Organism|Lung|Volume",   "Organism|Kidney|Volume",   "Organism|Brain|Volume",   "Organism|Muscle|Volume",   "Organism|LargeIntestine|Volume",   "Organism|PortalVein|Volume",   "Organism|Spleen|Volume",   "Organism|Skin|Volume",   "Organism|Pancreas|Volume",   "Organism|SmallIntestine|Mucosa|UpperIleum|Fraction mucosa",   "Organism|SmallIntestine|Volume",   "Organism|Lumen|Effective surface area variability factor",   "Organism|Bone|Volume",   "Organism|Stomach|Volume" ) mwf$plotSensitivity$settings <- SensitivityPlotSettings$new(   totalSensitivityThreshold = 0.9,   maximalParametersPerSensitivityPlot = 12,   xAxisFontSize = 10,   yAxisFontSize = 10 ) mwf$runWorkflow()

code: populationOutputs <- c(output1, output2) ps1 <- PopulationSimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "popSimulationSet1",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   populationFile = populationFile1,   outputs = populationOutputs )  ps2 <- PopulationSimulationSet$new(   simulationSetName = "popSimulationSet2",   simulationFile = simulationFile,   populationFile = populationFile2,   outputs = populationOutputs ) pwf <- PopulationWorkflow$new(   simulationSets = list(ps1, ps2),   workflowFolder = "popSensitivityExample",   workflowType = PopulationWorkflowTypes$parallelComparison ) pwf$calculateSensitivity$activate() pwf$plotSensitivity$activate() pwf$simulate$activate() pwf$calculatePKParameters$activate() pwf$calculateSensitivity$settings$variableParameterPaths <- c(   "Organism|Heart|Volume",   "Organism|Lung|Volume",   "Organism|Kidney|Volume",   "Organism|Brain|Volume",   "Organism|Muscle|Volume",   "Organism|LargeIntestine|Volume",   "Organism|PortalVein|Volume",   "Organism|Spleen|Volume",   "Organism|Skin|Volume",   "Organism|Pancreas|Volume",   "Organism|SmallIntestine|Mucosa|UpperIleum|Fraction mucosa",   "Organism|SmallIntestine|Volume",   "Organism|Lumen|Effective surface area variability factor",   "Organism|Bone|Volume",   "Organism|Stomach|Volume" ) pwf$calculateSensitivity$settings$quantileVec <- c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75) pwf$plotSensitivity$settings <- SensitivityPlotSettings$new(   totalSensitivityThreshold = 0.9,   maximalParametersPerSensitivityPlot = 12,   xAxisFontSize = 10,   yAxisFontSize = 10 ) pwf$runWorkflow() #> [1] FALSE #> [1] FALSE

title: How to work with word reports
text: rendering word report, Reporting Engine creates intermediate markdown report dedicated conversion ("report-word.md"). , intermediate report configuration options ("report-configuration.txt") provided pandoc using knitr package illustrated . Users can leverage features Reporting Engine processing markdown. content configuration options ("report-configuration.txt") described : option +raw_attribute allows pandoc leave raw code block . option convenient including page breaks bookmarks word reports described .
code: knitr::pandoc(input = "report-word.md", format = "docx", config = "report-configuration.txt") embed-resources: standalone: wrap: none toc: from: markdown+tex_math_dollars+superscript+subscript+raw_attribute reference-doc: <wordConversionTemplate> resource-path: <workflowFolder>

title: How to work with word reports
text: option +tex_math_dollars allows pandoc translate mathematical equations defined LaTeX. Unfortunately, translation works extent formatting options translated (e.g. \Huge - #1029). Inline equations can defined using within $..$ equation block within $$...$$ illustrated . render \[ \rightarrow B \rightarrow C \\ \frac{dA}{dt} = -k_aA  \\ \frac{dB}{dt} = k_aA - k_bB  \\ \frac{dC}{dt} = k_bB - k_cC \]
code: $$ A \rightarrow B \rightarrow C \\ \frac{dA}{dt} = -k_aA  \\ \frac{dB}{dt} = k_aA - k_bB  \\ \frac{dC}{dt} = k_bB - k_cC  \\ $$

title: How to work with word reports

title: addUserDefinedTask — addUserDefinedTask
code: if (FALSE) {  # A workflow object needs to be created first myWorkflow <- MeanModelWorkflow$new(workflowFolder, simulationSets)  # Create a function to output results for workflow # Mean model workflows functions usually expect SimulationStructure objects as inputs userDefinedFunction <- function(structureSet, settings = NULL) {   # Insert some code to calculate results and tune their output   userResults <- list()   userPlot <- ggplot()   userTable <- data.frame()   userText <- "Comments about the results of thMy user results"    userResults[[1]] <- saveTaskResults(     id = "user-result-1",     plot = userPlot,     plotCaption = "Title of Figure 1",     includePlot = TRUE,     table = userTable,     tableCaption = "Title of Table 1",     includeTable = TRUE,     textChunk = userText,     includeTextChunk = TRUE   )    # Tasks will run through the list of userResults   # And add their outputs to the report   return(userResults) }  # Add a user-defined task to workflow addUserDefinedTask(   workflow = myWorkflow,   taskFunction = userDefinedFunction,   taskName = "userDefinedTask",   active = TRUE )  # Checks structure of task using # myWorkflow$userDefinedTasks[[index]]$ }

title: getSelectedData — getSelectedData
code: data <- data.frame(   x = seq(0, 9),   y = seq(10, 19),   mdv = c(1, 1, rep(0, 8)),   groups = rep(c("A", "B"), 5) )  # Select all the data getSelectedData(data, DataSelectionKeys$ALL) #>    x  y mdv groups #> 1  0 10   1      A #> 2  1 11   1      B #> 3  2 12   0      A #> 4  3 13   0      B #> 5  4 14   0      A #> 6  5 15   0      B #> 7  6 16   0      A #> 8  7 17   0      B #> 9  8 18   0      A #> 10 9 19   0      B  # Select no data getSelectedData(data, DataSelectionKeys$NONE) #> [1] x      y      mdv    groups #> <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names)  # Select data from group A getSelectedData(data, "groups %in% 'A'") #>   x  y mdv groups #> 1 0 10   1      A #> 2 2 12   0      A #> 3 4 14   0      A #> 4 6 16   0      A #> 5 8 18   0      A  # Remove missing dependent variable (mdv) getSelectedData(data, "mdv == 0") #>   x  y mdv groups #> 1 2 12   0      A #> 2 3 13   0      B #> 3 4 14   0      A #> 4 5 15   0      B #> 5 6 16   0      A #> 6 7 17   0      B #> 7 8 18   0      A #> 8 9 19   0      B

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.2.0
text: article demography updated comprehensive examples using representative virtual populations illustrating effects population workflows settings (#1095, #1102) Categorical parameters, Gender, now accounted demography range plots displayed boxplots (#1088) Demography plots can now display observed data (#535) dedicated article mass balance created documentation (#1118) Mass balance plots can leverage user-defined settings json files illustrated mass balance article (#1118) Normalized mass balance plots now use time-dependent cumulative drug mass normalization (#1039, #1118) Delta symbol (δ) Guest et al. formula indicated table caption (1069) Guest criterion (δ) can tuned configuration plan (#789) DDI plot format quadratic default (#1051) Formatting word reports can translate additional html tags (#382)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.2.0
text: Monte Carlo sampling ratio comparison workflows now centralized, performed PK parameter calculation step significantly faster (#536, #1086). Wording ratio comparison workflow figures tables updated (#1087) Number bins demography PK parameter range plots consistent input (#1128) Link/bookmark targets word reports better placed (#1084) Qualification time profiles work observed data contained (#1082) Static images qualification reports better handled (#955, #1071) Figure captions displayed figure reports (#1053) Word report updated already existed (#1055) LLOQ line better displayed legend time profile plots (#478)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.1.244
text: Population workflows can use Monte Carlo sampling handle ratio comparison (#536) documented article PK Parameters Population Workflows. Output objects can now include color fill properties displayed corresponding plots (#418, #883) dataSelection now available SimulationSet Output levels (#881) Excel template --date new features (#882) documented article Excel Template Mean Population workflows can display title/cover page beginning report (#854) documented article Add title page workflow report Qualification Time Profiles handle dual axis plots (#934, #985)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.1.244
text: qualification workflows, logging now includes information regarding configuration plan location (#930) default, plot dimensions now quadratic (#877) Statistics population workflow time profiles now use geometric mean sd default can easily updated enum helper StatisticsTypes function setDefaultTimeProfileStatistics() (#862) Goodness fit plots captions improved (#418, #863, #865, #867, #871, #874, #875, #878, #884, #886, #887, #888) better scaled watermark (#849) margin added prevent truncated ticklabels (#951) gof time profile use correct colors (#952) residual label match calculation method (#953) legend shrink plot size (#861) page breaks appropriate places (#971) figure/table numbering (#967) now fixed default reference word document updated (#748, #749, #750 #754) tags subscript (wrapped <sub>...</sub>) superscript (wrapped <sup>...</sup>) converted word (#968) equations wrapped $$...$$ written LaTeX format converted word bookmarks now created markdown anchors (#923) Qualification time profiles use base unit unit defined user (#867, #991)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.1
text: Qualification Workflows vignette help start (#566) template qualification workflow R script available GitHub system.file("extdata", "qualification-workflow-template.R", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine") can also downloaded GitHub (#572) Function adjustTitlePage can used personalize report title page (#755) Configuration plans can re-loaded QualificationWorkflow objects update report display (#567) DDI subunits option available (#642) ospsuite version 10, simulations can run parallel (#526) Workflows account time offset simulation sets using option timeOffset time profile plots (#313) user defined PK parameters PK parameter plots (#578). User can define word report template tune styles report providing reference word document wordConversionTemplate Workflow object. word reference template available GitHub (#756) function copyReport can used copy markdown/word reports (#814)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 2.1
text: tlf version 1.2.0, plots log scale better displayed (#603) long legend captions now displayed multiple lines (#568, #602) Output objects now cloneable (#542) population workflows, option adding reference observed data time profile plots created (#540). Confusing observed data terminology starting nonmem replaced dataset (#534)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 1.2.0
text: Descriptor simulation sets now available can defined Excel template (#445) well using function setSimulationDescriptor (#423). task property settings now R6 object (#396). allows users easy direct access setting properties. Possibility read time measurement units nonmem columns (#414)

title: ospsuite.reportingengine 1.2.0
text: Calculation time profile residuals can use Linear Logarithmic scale (#395). Units observed data appropriately taken account within dictionary (#414). Settings number format within reports now available (#424). can updated global settings using setDefaultNumericFormat within specific tasks settings property. settings property task plotTimeProfilesAndResiduals include Application Ranges can switched /SimulationSet objects regarding simulations multiple administrations (#419) Population workflows: captions tables (PK parameters) missing (#421) Population workflows: units tables (PK parameters) missing (#422) Population/RatioComparison: box-Whisker Ratio plots (#425)

Excel input file template available system.file("extdata", "WorkflowInput.xlsx", package = "ospsuite.reportingengine") setWorkflowParameterDisplayPathsFromFile overwrites display path names simulation parameters workflow plotDemography plotPKParameters tasks (#399). input needs csv file parameter displayPath header.
